isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - INSTALL - Adjusting the Backlash of the Ring Gear

svcproc.title: Adjusting the Backlash of the Ring Gear
svcproc.para: 140 and 145 Series Carriers: Range of Backlash Setting: 0.008-0.018 inch (0.20-0.46 mm)
140 and 145 Series Carriers: Backlash Setting For New Gear Sets: 0.012 Inch (0.30 mm)
160 Series: Range of Backlash Setting: 0.010-0.020 inch (0.025-0.51 mm)
160 Series: Backlash Setting For New Gear Sets: 0.012 inch (0.30 mm)
If the old gear set is installed, adjust the backlash to the setting that was measured before the carrier was disassembled.
If a new gear set is installed, adjust the backlash to the correct specification for new gear sets.
During the check of the tooth contact patterns, the backlash can be adjusted within specification limits to change the location of the pattern.

step1.para: Attach a dial indicator on the mounting flange of the carrier ( Figure 132).

figure.caption: Figure 132. Attach Dial Indicator on Mounting Flange

step1.para: Adjust the dial indicator so that the plunger is against a tooth surface.
Adjust the dial indicator to zero (0).
Hold the drive pinion in position.

While you read the dial indicator, rotate the differential and ring gear a small amount in both directions, against the teeth of the drive pinion. If the backlash reading is within specification, continue by checking tooth contact patterns. If the backlash reading is not within specifications, adjust backlash as needed.
Loosen one bearing adjusting ring one notch, then tighten the opposite ring the same amount ( Figure 133 and Figure 134).

item.para: Backlash is increased by moving the ring gear away from the drive pinion.
Backlash is decreased by moving the ring gear toward the drive pinion.

note.para: When you adjust backlash, only move the ring gear. Do not move the drive pinion.

figure.caption: Figure 133. Loosen Adjusting Ring One Notch, Then Tighten Opposite Ring One Notch
Figure 134. Loosen Adjusting Ring One Notch, Then Tighten Opposite Ring One Notch

step1.para: Repeat Steps 2-6 until the backlash is within specifications. Record the setting for use when you adjust the preload of the pinion bearing
